comment.author: 92803452@N04
comment._content:
We can no longer refer to persons, in Trinidad and Tobago, who are of East Indian decent as 'Coolies' as this term is now categorised as derogatory, racial in nature.

'East Indian' descendants, they are to be called or someone of Indian descent. There is the East Indian Arrival Day - a national public holiday, at the end of May every year in Trinidad and Tobago and the political correctness of how the descendants of India are to be referred to, their collective contribution to nation building, cultural traditions, dress-wear, food, native languages, religion, etc are all celebrated on this day.
